case_title: The State vs. Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi and Others

accussed_details.name: Bushra Imran
accussed_details.designation: Trustee of Al-Qadir University Project Trust
allegation: Aiding and abetting misuse of authority

complaint_summary: Allegations of corruption and misuse of authority by Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi and Bushra Imran involving illegal diversion of £190 million frozen by the UK's National Crime Agency, benefiting Malik Riaz Hussain and the Al-Qadir University Project Trust.
investigation_summary: NAB initiated an inquiry in July 2022, upgraded to investigation in April 2023. Evidence included financial records, trust deeds, Cabinet meeting minutes, and witness testimonies corroborating misuse of authority and illegal gratification.
judgment_summary: Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi convicted under Sections 9(a)(ii), (iv), (vi), and (xii) of the NAO, 1999; sentenced to 14 years rigorous imprisonment and fined Rs. 1 million. Bushra Imran convicted under Section 9(a)(xii) of the NAO, 1999; sentenced to 7 years rigorous imprisonment and fined Rs. 500,000. Al-Qadir University Project Trust assets forfeited to the Federal Government.
punishment: Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi: 14 years rigorous imprisonment, Rs. 1 million fine, 6 months additional imprisonment for default. Bushra Imran: 7 years rigorous imprisonment, Rs. 500,000 fine, 3 months additional imprisonment for default. Forfeiture of Al-Qadir University Project Trust assets.
Decision_or_verdict: Conviction of Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi and Bushra Imran for corruption and misuse of authority.
legal_arguments: Prosecution argued misuse of authority and illegal gratification.
Defense claimed political victimization and good faith actions.

witness_statement.Cabinet members: Confirmed violations of Rules of Business, 1973 and lack of consultation.
witness_statement.NAB officials: Provided evidence of financial transactions and trust deeds.
witness_statement.Other witnesses: Corroborated allegations of misuse of authority and illegal gratification.

key_issues: Conflict of interest in trust establishment

key_events.nca_investigation: £190 million frozen under the UK Proceeds of Crime Act (2018-2019).
key_events.supreme_court_decision: Ordered Bahria Town to pay Rs. 460 billion for illegally acquired land (2019).
key_events.asset_recovery_unit: Established under Imran Khan's government to recover unlawful foreign assets.
key_events.confidentiality_deed: Signed by Shahzad Akbar with NCA to repatriate funds to Pakistan (2019).
key_events.al_qadir_trust_creation: Trust established with land donations from Bahria Town (2019).
key_events.land_transfer: 240 kanals of land transferred to Farhat Shahzadi (2021).

legal_principles.public_office_trust: Public office holders are trustees of public resources.
legal_principles.conflict_of_interest: Accused acted in personal interests over the State's.

words_and_phrases.Illegal gratification: Receiving benefits in exchange for unlawful actions.
words_and_phrases.Conflict of interest: Situation where personal interests interfere with official duties.

summary_vector_notes: Case involves allegations of corruption and misuse of authority by Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi and Bushra Imran, focusing on illegal diversion of funds and personal benefits derived from the Al-Qadir University Project Trust.
background: Alleged corruption and misuse of authority by Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi and others involving the diversion of £190 million frozen by the UK's National Crime Agency (NCA). Funds intended for the State of Pakistan were diverted to settle Bahria Town's liabilities.

prosecution_case.allegations: Misuse of authority to benefit Bahria Town in exchange for illegal monetary gains and land donations.
prosecution_case.evidence: Documentary evidence and witness testimonies presented.

defense_arguments.denial: Imran Khan and Bushra Imran denied wrongdoing, claiming political motivation.
defense_arguments.cabinet_decision: Defense argued funds repatriation was approved in good faith.

court_findings.misuse_of_authority: Imran Khan misused authority to divert funds to Bahria Town.
court_findings.quid_pro_quo: Land and donations to Al-Qadir Trust were illegal gratifications.
court_findings.violation_of_trust_laws: Amendments to Al-Qadir Trust deed were illegal.
court_findings.loss_to_exchequer: Diversion of £171.159 million caused significant loss to Pakistan.

outcome: Convicts taken into custody; further proceedings against proclaimed offenders ongoing.
